title: Keep disconnecting at Loading screens
body: Ever since the new patch, when i start a game, it will load normally for a bit, then my ping will jump to 999 and then i will get disconnected. Help!! :(

replies.body:
Hey Sytosis,

Please follow the steps on the [Connection Troubleshooting Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to make sure your connection is set up properly.

You can run a [tracert described here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs) to check where your lag is starting. I'd suggest hard resetting your modem and router by unplugging them for 5 minutes. If it's packet loss you're getting and it doesn't go away, you may need to contact your ISP for help. If you are still getting lag on your end, please post the results of your tracert here. Let me know if anything works.

-DTN

Tracing route to 103.240.227.25 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1     1 ms     1 ms    <1 ms  192.168.1.1 
  2    57 ms    62 ms    59 ms  rdl800.ba.optusnet.com.au [198.142.130.26] 
  3     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  4     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  5     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  6     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  7    91 ms   101 ms    96 ms  59.154.142.94 
  8   105 ms    88 ms    89 ms  61.88.116.210 
  9     *        *      102 ms  104.160.156.37 
 10   102 ms   100 ms    98 ms  104.160.156.105 
 11     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 12     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 13     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 14     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 15     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 16     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 17     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 18     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 19     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 20     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 21     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 22     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 23     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 24     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 25     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 26     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 27     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 28     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 29     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 30     *        *        *     Request timed out.

Trace complete.

Hey Sytosis,

One of the Wrenchman helped me with some corrections. The *Request Timed out* could be caused by those particular servers not responding to ICMP request, which isn't an issue but interferes with a traceroute.

He (SephirothSG) suggests downloading the [WinMTR Network Diagnostic Tool](http://winmtr.net/download-winmtr/). Use that to run a traceroute to the following IP's (allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)

>103.240.227.25
103.240.227.5

Export the results to a text file and paste them here.

> ##Disregard and read the other reply please.

Ok, when it says "Request timed out", that means the data isn't getting back to you and is called "Packet Loss". Sometimes it'll be indicated by * asterisks.

Anyway, if you haven't hard reset your router and modem yet, do that and run the tracert again. If you have done so and are still showing packet loss like this, you'll want to contact your ISP so they can fix it.
